adventure_overview: People have been fishing since long before they started farming.  Today most people fish as a hobby or just for fun, and not for survival.  In this Adventure you will get ready to learn the basics of fishing where you live and join your family, den, or pack on a fishing trip. Do wolves fish in the wild? Yes, they do. In Alaska wolves fish for salmon, and in Minnesota they fish for freshwater fish in creeks.  Let’s learn about the different types of water in which fish and how to catch them. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved.

requirements.text: Identify the type of water you will be fishing in and what type of fish live in the water.

activities.name: Fish Name Game
activities.description: Play a game and learn about the diverse local fish species within your state.

activities.name: Fishery Visit
activities.description: Visit a fishery or a fish hatchery .

activities.name: Who’s That Fish?
activities.description: A game of Who’s that Fish? Where Cub Scouts  guess what fish  is pictured  and if it is native .

requirements.text: Learn about the different types of bait used to attract fish.

activities.name: Bait-ology Bonanza
activities.description: Learn  about fishing bait s  with a memory game .

requirements.text: Demonstrate a proper cast for the pole or rod you are using.

activities.name: Cast & Learn
activities.description: Learn  how to cast  a  fishing pole with accuracy by trying to hit a target.

activities.name: Cast-A-Thon Relay Challenge
activities.description: Cub Scouts practice casting their pole or rod to catch a paper fish.

activities.name: Crazy Casting Spin-Off
activities.description: Cub Scouts practice their casting skills  by distance and accuracy .

requirements.text: Learn the rules of fishing safely.

activities.name: Bait and Switch Safety Rules Game
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn the fishing safety rules in this flashcard game.

activities.name: Hook, Line, and Safety Poster
activities.description: Cub Scouts make a poster about fishing safety.

activities.name: Tacklebox Trivia
activities.description: A fun and interactive way to learn the rules of fishing safely through a jeopardy-type game.

requirements.text: With your den, pack, or family, go fishing.

activities.name: Go Fish
activities.description: Cub Scouts go on a fishing expedition with their den.
